about-us.title: About Us
about-us.paragraph1: Hello! I am Maria da Conceição, but you can call me São.
about-us.paragraph2: It is with great pleasure that I present to you the story of my latest life project. It all started with an abandoned stone house, waiting for a new life, where I embarked on the exciting adventure of its reconstruction. A true work of love and dedication that gradually brought this new and cozy space, Casa da Vila, to life.
about-us.paragraph3: Even though I am close to retirement, I couldn't stop working. I found my great passions in decoration and the art of welcoming people, and I decided to combine these two worlds in this project. Every detail, from the lovingly chosen furniture to the little surprises I've prepared for our guests, reflects my dedication to providing a truly cozy and memorable stay.
about-us.signature: Maria da Conceição Ferreira da Silva

rooms.description1: Casa Da Vila - Local Accommodation is a renovated stone house, divided into two apartments on the ground floor and first floor.
rooms.description2: The exterior maintains the typical style of the region, with doors and windows in wine tones, reflecting the color of Fundão cherries.
rooms.description3: The interior combines rusticity with a clean and cozy design.

RoadTimelineHistorical.title: Historical Villages
description: Casa da Vila is a true treasure for Heritage and History enthusiasts.
Located in a region surrounded by various Historical Villages, such as our neighbor Castelo Novo, Monsanto, Belmonte, and Sortelha.
From here, you can embark on an authentic journey through time, exploring the heart of Portugal.
Enjoy our suggested itinerary, we hope you like it!

routes.title: Castelo Novo (6.5km)
description: In the heart of Serra da Gardunha, Castelo Novo rises in shades of green and gray.
In the heart of Serra da Gardunha, the Historical Village of Castelo Novo rises in shades of green and gray. Built on granite, Castelo Novo preserves a unique architectural heritage.

routes.title: Monsanto (41km)
description: Perched on a hilltop that commands views from most horizons. A unique charm.
Perched on a hilltop that commands views from most horizons, the Historical Village of Monsanto holds a unique charm.

routes.title: Belmonte (44km)
description: Land of Pedro Álvares Cabral, offering a wide view of Serra da Estrela.

Land of Pedro Álvares Cabral, located in the heart of Cova da Beira and with a wide view of the eastern slope of Serra da Estrela, the village of Belmonte fully justifies the characteristics that gave it its name.

routes.title: Sortelha (56.5km)
description: Its urban and architectural features have remained unchanged since the Renaissance.
Sortelha is one of the most beautiful and ancient Portuguese villages, having maintained its urban and architectural features unchanged since the Renaissance to this day.

RoadTimelineSchist.title: Schist Villages
description: Among the winding mountains of Estrela, Açor, and Gardunha, or along the serene banks of the Tejo, Ocreza, and Zêzere rivers, lies the network of the 27 Schist Villages, an invaluable treasure of our region and heritage.

For adventurers seeking this immense historical, cultural, and natural wealth, Casa Da Vila suggests two of the most captivating Schist Villages that, curiously, are located in our municipality of Fundão.
Enjoy our suggested itinerary, and we hope you like it!

routes.title: Barroca (39.8km)
description: On a small hill, flanked by two streams, near the Zêzere river.
The oldest part of the village is situated along a small hill, flanked by two deeply carved streams, forming a set perpendicular to the course of the Zêzere, with which it borders.

routes.title: Janeiro de Cima (52.1km)
description: Walk through the maze of winding streets where the houses reveal their characteristic schist facades.

Janeiro de Cima is located on the left bank of the Zêzere, surrounded by an extensive blanket of agricultural land. Walk through the maze of winding streets where the houses reveal their characteristic schist facades.

RoadTimelineGardunha.title: Gardunha Mountain
description: Explore its trails and marvel at the stunning panoramic views as you venture through the slopes of this imposing mountain range.
Come and explore this regional treasure and be enchanted by its unique beauty.
Enjoy our suggested itinerary, and we hope you like it!

routes.title: Hiking Trails, Trail Running, or MTB
description: Traverse the Routes of Serra da Gardunha, an immersive and fascinating journey.
Explore the Routes of Serra da Gardunha, an immersive and fascinating journey through the Natura 2000 natural reserve and the Naturtejo Geopark.

routes.title: Casa do Guarda
description: Spacious leisure areas and a stunning view of the majestic surrounding mountains.

At this charming spot, you will find spacious leisure areas equipped with tables, barbecue grills, and spaces to prepare delicious outdoor meals, along with a stunning view of the majestic surrounding mountains.

RoadTimelineEstrela.title: Estrela Mountain
description: Explore its trails and marvel at the stunning panoramic views as you venture through the slopes of this imposing mountain range.
Come and explore this regional treasure and be enchanted by its unique beauty.
Enjoy our suggested itinerary, and we hope you like it!

routes.title: Torre
description: The highest point in mainland Portugal, standing at 1993 meters above sea level.
The highest point in mainland Portugal, standing at 1993 meters above sea level. A 7-meter tower has been constructed to symbolically bring the highest point to 2000 meters.

routes.title: Seia
description: One of the most important cities located at the foot of the Serra da Estrela Natural Park.
Situated at 550 meters altitude, Seia is one of the most important cities located at the foot of the Serra da Estrela Natural Park and a gateway to the highest point in mainland Portugal (Torre).

RoadTimelineAlpedrinha.title: Alpedrinha
description: Explore its trails and marvel at the stunning panoramic views as you venture through the slopes of this imposing region.
Come and explore this regional treasure and be enchanted by its unique beauty.
Enjoy our suggested itinerary, and we hope you like it!

routes.title: Palácio do Picadeiro
description: 18th-century palace. Recently restored and transformed into a cultural museum.

Built in the 18th century by a magistrate, this mansion went through various hands and functions, from a court to a hospital and even a newspaper printing press. Abandoned for years, it was recently restored and turned into a cultural museum.

routes.title: Chafariz D. João V
description: Built by order of D. João V. It is structured in two levels with a U-shaped staircase, in Baroque style.
Built by order of D. João V. It is structured in two levels with a U-shaped staircase. This Baroque fountain is made of granite and consists of a bastion with three faces, each with its own spout.

routes.title: Paços do Concelho
description: Former town hall building, constructed in 1680, with a rectangular plan and three floors.

The former town hall building, constructed in 1680, has a rectangular plan with three floors. Between 1972 and 1973, it underwent restoration work and was later home to the Parish Council and a recreational association.

routes.title: Terreiro de Santo António
description: Historic square in Alpedrinha known for its architectural charm and historical significance.
Terreiro de Santo António is a historic square in Alpedrinha with notable architectural charm and historical importance. It reflects the rich heritage of the region.

routes.title: Casa do Pátio
description: Casa do Pátio, also known as Solar dos Britos, is a manor house known for the fountain located on the balcony of the main façade.

Casa do Pátio, or Solar dos Britos, is a baroque manor house with a rectangular plan, featuring three floors defined by friezes and a main façade divided into three sections. The highlight is the fountain on the balcony of the main façade.

routes.title: Igreja Matriz
description: A Mannerist church with three naves and four bays, a narrower and lower chancel, a sacristy, and an annex.

A Mannerist church with three naves and four bays, a narrower and lower chancel, a sacristy, and an annex. It was rebuilt between 1557 and 1578 over a primitive temple dating from the 12th/13th century.

routes.title: Teatro Clube de Alpedrinha
description: The first theater to appear in the Castelo Branco District, currently one of its main cultural hubs.
The Teatro Clube de Alpedrinha was the first theater to be established in the Castelo Branco District, and today it remains one of the region’s leading cultural hubs.

routes.title: Igreja da Misericórdia
description: Right next to Casa da Vila, it is a remarkable example of Mannerist architecture from the late 16th and early 17th century.

Located in the heart of the village, and immediately next to Casa da Vila, the Igreja da Misericórdia de Alpedrinha stands out as a notable example of Mannerist architecture from the late 16th and early 17th century.

RoadTimelineFestivals.title: Festivals and Pilgrimages
